CAB I Ng f,RETAIL HJSI.I!?SS (LICENSING) ORPjBR.(Note by the Secretary)..(Circulated for information with reference toH.A.C. 45, Minute 2:1 .On November 6th last, the Home Affairs Committee decidedthat unless very substantial economies could he effected in theadministration of the Retail Business (licensing) order theOrder should not be retained; and requested the Minister ofLabour and the Food Controller to confer with a view to seeingwhat economies could be introduced into the administration ofthe order,prom information received from the Minister cf Labourit is understood that a conference has accordingly been heldbetween representatives of the Ministry of Labour and the PoodController at which it was agreed that substantial economiescould net be effected in the administration of the Order.It has therefore been agreed to revoke the Order as from31st December next, and steps are being taken accordingly.(Sgd.) M.P.A. HANCT',Secretary,Cabinet.2, Whitehall Gardens, s.W. 1*12th pec ember, 1919*ftJTHIS POCUMFNT IS TH? PROPERTY 0? HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTYT3 OOJWMMlh
